title: Tuscaloosa, Alabama
summary: Tuscaloosa (/tʌskəˈluːsə/ TUS-kə-LOO-sə) is a city in and the seat of Tuscaloosa County in west-central Alabama, United States,[3] on the Black Warrior River where the Gulf Coastal and Piedmont plains meet. Alabama's fifth-largest city, it had an estimated population of 101,129 in 2019. It was known as Tuskaloosa until the early 20th century.[4] It is also known as the Druid City because of the numerous water oaks planted in its downtown streets since the 1840s.
